title: Patriots injury report: RB Terrell Jennings out, LB Robert Spillane questionable vs. Bills

title: Will Sunday’s Bills-Patriots game be a snow game? Here’s what latest weather projections say
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Most forecasts project snow on Sunday, but the precipitation might stop before the Bills-Patriots game begins.
Gillette Stadium has played host to a handful of memorable snow games over the years.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche December 12, 2025 | 3:59 PM 2 minutes to read If Sunday’s Bills-Patriots game already wasn’t exciting enough, Mother Nature might provide some extra fun to the action at Gillette Stadium.

title: Tewksbury police search for driver who allegedly mowed down flock of seagulls on purpose
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Tewksbury police said they found six dead seagulls in the strip mall parking lot.
Tewksbury police are looking to identify a driver accused of intentionally running over and killing several seagulls Thursday.

title: Celtics star Jaylen Brown jumps up in NBA.com’s latest MVP rankings
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "He’s riding a rocket up the Ladder, moving five spots this week, the largest leap of anyone this season.
" Jaylen Brown has jumped up to fifth in the latest Kia MVP rankings (Charles Krupa/AP Photo).
Although the Celtics’ five-game win streak ended Thursday night in a 116-101 loss to the Bucks, Jaylen Brown put up another impressive performance.

title: ‘Prominent’ agent says Red Sox ‘don’t believe in long-term deals’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox missed out on signing rumored targets Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber after they agreed to five-year deals with different teams this week.
The Red Sox haven't signed a free agent to a deal that's more than three years long in Craig Breslow's tenure as chief baseball officer.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Roche December 12, 2025 | 2:03 PM 2 minutes to read The Red Sox were considered to be among the favorites to land top free agents Pete Alonso or Kyle Schwarber entering this week’s Winter Meetings.
